glsa.title: Festival: Privilege elevation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in Festival, allowing for a local privilege escalation.

background.p: Festival is a text-to-speech accessibility program.

description.p: Konstantine Shirow reported a vulnerability in default Gentoo configurations of Festival. The daemon is configured to run with root privileges and to listen on localhost, without requiring a password.

impact.p: A local attacker could gain root privileges by connecting to the daemon and execute arbitrary commands.

workaround.p: Set a password in the configuration file /etc/festival/server.scm by adding the line: (set! server_passwd password)

resolution.p: All Festival users should upgrade to the latest version:
